http://statweb.stanford.edu/~tibs/lasso/simple.html
install.packages("gglasso")
require(gglasso)
install.packages("lars")
require(lars)
data(diabetes)
str(diabetes)
lar <- lars(diabetes$x, diabetes$y, type = "lar",
    trace = FALSE, normalize = TRUE, intercept = TRUE, Gram, 
    eps = .Machine$double.eps, use.Gram = FALSE)
    

par(mfrow=c(2,2))
attach(diabetes)
object <- lars(diabetes$x,diabetes$y)
plot(object)
object2 <- lars(diabetes$x,diabetes$y,type="lar")
plot(object2)
object3 <- lars(diabetes$x,diabetes$y,type="for") # Can use abbreviations
plot(object3)

plot(diabetes$x, xvar= c("norm", "df", "arc.length", "step"), 
    breaks = TRUE, plottype = c("coefficients","Cp"), 
    omit.zeros = TRUE, eps = 1e-10)
    
object <- lars(diabetes$x,diabetes$y)
plot(object)

fits <- predict.lars(object, diabetes$x, type="fit")

predict(object, newx, s, type = c("fit", "coefficients"), mode = c("step",
"fraction", "norm", "lambda"),)

summary(object, sigma2=NULL)
